utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God! You cleaned! Look at these floors! You did the windows! Oh, I have been begging you for months and you did! You cleaned! And nagging works!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y’know uh, I didn’t actually do this.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh no, was I cleaning in my sleep again?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, it wasn’t you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well then who?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I got a maid. Yay!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I hope by maid you mean mistress, because if some other woman was here cleaning then…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Uh honey, I know you don’t like to relinquish control…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, relinquish is just a fancy word for lose!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look, she’s really nice. Okay? And she mentioned that she adored the way that you arranged the sponges.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Did she really say that?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, I distinctly remember ‘cause I thought it was a joke. Now just give her a chance, okay?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Fine, I can do it. Whew.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What’s the matter?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, usually when I’m this anxious, I clean!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Who’s cell phone is that? It’s just so annoying; everywhere you go.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I think it’s coming from your bag.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I never get calls!! Hello?

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Hi, it’s Eric. From the Halloween party, Ursula’s fiancée.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God Eric hi! Wait, how’d you get this number?

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Oh, I have a friend who’s a cop and he got it for me.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow! What an incredible violation—and wonderful surprise.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Uh listen, I just—I thought you should know I broke up with Ursula.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh you did? He did it! He did it!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow! What did he do?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Shhh! I’m talking.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Anyway, I was wondering if, you were the sort of person who…eats lunch.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Are you asking me out? ‘Cause it would be kinda weird since you just broke up with my sister.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Yeah uh…okay. I’m-I’m sorry. Bye.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No! Wait! I was just saying that so you’d think I was a good person. Fight for me.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Uhh, I won’t take no for an answer.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Not great, but we can work on it at lunch. Okay, I can be at your apartment in two hours.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Great! But wh-wh—How do you know where I live?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’ve got friends too. Okay, bye.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God! I’m going out with Eric! Ooh, this day is really gonna be so much better than I thought it was gonna be. Oh Ross, I can’t make lunch.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So apparently I’m available for lunch.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I can’t. I’m busy. I’m apartment hunting.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You’re moving?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, I can’t live with Joey once the baby comes. I don’t want my child’s first words to be, "How you doin’?"

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So does-does Joey know you’re moving?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I haven’t discussed it with him yet, but I know he’s gonna be relieved. Last week, he brought this girl over and I started talking to her about morning sickness and then I showed her pictures from my pregnancy book.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s not really porn.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Not so much.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, y’know what and if you’re looking for a place? I just heard in the elevator this morning that a woman in my building died.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God! Was she old? Does she have a view?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well I don’t know, but how-how great would that be huh? You living in my building. I could help take care of the baby. I can come over whenever I want. With your permission.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah that would really be great.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well can we see it?! Oh maybe we shouldn’t. I mean if she just died this morning out of respect.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah. No. No you’re right.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Shall we?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi. I’m Ross Geller. I live in the building.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And I’m Rachel, an admirer of the building.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I-I heard about Mrs. Verhoeven passing away and I’m so sorry for your loss.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, thank God!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ahh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Of course! Uh yeah, she and I would talk all the time in-in the laundry room.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y’know I would it’s just painful.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So she’s really not dead.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hmm. Do you think—Could you tell me if she’s hanging in, in a one bedroom or a two?

utterance.speaker: Brenda
utterance.content: Mrs. Bing, this tile cleaner is incredible! Where’d you get it?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh well umm, I make it myself! It’s two parts ammonia and one part lemon juice. And now the secret ingredient is…y’know what? We just met.

utterance.speaker: Brenda
utterance.content: Okay. Uhh, I’m gonna go get the clothes from the laundry room now. And, when I come back I’ll clean behind the refrigerator.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I love her.

utterance.speaker: Brenda
utterance.content: I’ll be back in a minute.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: See? I told you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: She stole my jeans!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I have been looking for them all week and she is wearing them!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So she stole your pants and then she came back and wore them in front of you?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Don’t you see? It’s the perfect crime!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: She must’ve been planning this for years!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I will prove it to you! Okay? About a week ago I was wearing those jeans and I dropped a pen in my lap and it left an ink stain on the crotch. Now when she comes back I will find it and show you that stain!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Honey, isn’t it possible that the company that sold the jeans made more than just the one pair?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I guess.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So, shouldn’t we go give her the benefit of the doubt before we go…snooping around her crotch?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Fine. I’m just glad I didn’t give her my secret ingredient.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Out of curiosity, what is your secret ingredient?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Come in, I’m so glad you’re here.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, me too. Not in the shaky angry way you are though.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Sorry, I just saw Ursula. I had to give the engagement ring back.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Just seeing her brought it all back. All the lies, the way she used me. I just…I got so angry just looking at her……face.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I just…when I look at you I see her. When I see her I get a little bit angry.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Maybe this is too weird.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: No wait! There’s only a problem when I look at you. Oh I got it! I got it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No don’t tear out your eyes!!

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: I was just, I was just gonna take out my lenses.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, yeah try that. So, is that better?

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Not really. You…you’re blurry, but you still look like Ursula. You’re Blursula. Okay wait. Maybe…If I-if I just don’t look at you for a while. See? It…it works. I’m not, I’m not angry at all anymore! This is a great date!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Look Eric, turn around. Look, I like you, but it shouldn’t be this hard. Y’know? This is our first date y’know? First dates are supposed to be about excitement and electricity and ‘Ooh, he just touched my hand, did he mean to touch my hand?’ and y’know first kisses and……second kisses.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thanks for the coffee, or bedankt voor de koffie, Gunter.

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Jij spreekt Nederlands? Dat is te gek. Heb je familie daar?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, we’re done.

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Ezel.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ezel? Ezel? Ezel?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Ross! Listen, do you want to go see that new Imax movie on tide pools?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Really?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No. But I got Knicks tickets for you, me, and Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sweet!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, well finish your coffee; let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay I-I just have to stop by my place first.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: To tape the game? You do this every time Ross, you’re not gonna be on TV!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No-no, I-I have to see if this apartment became available.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, you’re switching apartments?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It’s not for me, it’s for Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: But Rachel has an apartment.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, but when the baby comes she’s gonna want to move.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: She is?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, you didn’t expect her to live there with a baby did you?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I guess I didn’t really think about it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ezel! Hey Gunther! You’re an ezel!

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Jij hebt seks met ezels.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Damnit!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nice jeans!

utterance.speaker: Brenda
utterance.content: Oh thanks! I like your top.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh. You’re not gettin’ it.

utterance.speaker: Brenda
utterance.content: What happened?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, I fell asleep.

utterance.speaker: Brenda
utterance.content: I was thinking about taking my lunch break.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, will you do the top of the cabinets? That’ll really work up your appetite for lunch.

utterance.speaker: Brenda
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Brenda
utterance.content: What’s going on?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I’ve never had a maid before, is this not okay?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: How was the game?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, okay. I…I ate way too much.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ooh. So umm, I was talkin’ to Ross and he said you were looking for a new place.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yeah! Hopefully across the street if certain Dutch people would just let go.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I was kinda hoping you’d stay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh but Joey, I have to go. There’s no room for a baby here.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No room? It’s a baby. It’s like this big. Y’know, I mean you-you could you could put it over here. Or-or-or we could put it right here. Aw, it’s cute, right? Or-or we could put it over here. You wouldn’t even notice it. Where’s the baby?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Honey, it’s not just a matter of where you put it. I mean a baby changes everything. They cry all the time. I mean imagine bringing home some girl and trying to score when there’s a screaming baby around.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I could use a challenge! It’s getting pretty easy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Honey, it’s so sweet that you want me to stay, but I-I can’t do that to you. I mean it would disrupt your entire life.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I love living with you so much. I just wish things didn’t have to change.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Y’know I blame Ross for this.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I do too a little bit.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m gonna miss you, you’re the hottest roommate I ever had.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, oh no! I have to go! I have a massage appointment.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Oh no, stay here we’ll keep doing this. I’ll pay you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, I got in trouble for that before. I’ll see you later.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Absolutely. I love the way you kiss.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Really? That’s the thing I’m worse at! You’ll see.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey! Umm, I think Brenda needs a raise.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: How come?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Because I put my head between her legs.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: To see her pants?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: They’re my pants!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Are you sure? Did you see the stain?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No! I was just getting into position and then everything went dark.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: God! She is not stealing from us! Okay, will you let this go?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Fine. She’s wearing my bra!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh dear God!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: My pink flowered bra! I recognize the strap!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And yet you don’t recognize that you’re crazy.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Here’s the plan! Okay? I’m going to leave you get a look at Brenda’s bra!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Here’s another plan…No!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I would do it but she thinks I’m attracted to her!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Did you not hear where my head was? Come on! Come on we’re a team! We’re in this together!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I fear a jury will see it the same way!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Do this for me! Come on, I catch you looking at woman’s breasts all the time!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You see that?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Do you see this?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right. Yes. Okay. I get your point. But if it’s not your bra will you just let the woman clean the apartment?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yes! Absolutely. Okay? Look, you’ll know it’s mine because on the right cup, the lacey part, there’s a very noticeable rip.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You need new clothes.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi. How is she?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh. Oh. Well I uh, I brought her some bloemen.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh I don’t know that it would.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right then.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Welcome back!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey! Can we pick up where we left off?

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: I don’t know, I’m still pretty tired out from this afternoon.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Uh, the sex.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What sex?

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Our sex.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: We didn’t have sex.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Well if I didn’t have sex with you, I had sex with someone that looked an awful lot like…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ew! Ew! Ew! Ew! Ew! Ew!

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Oh no! Oh no! Oh no! Oh no! No! No! No!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You-you…you had sex with Ursula?!

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Uh, a little bit. She-she-she walked in and I thought she was you and I kissed her and…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You didn’t notice she was wearing different clothes?!

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Well I was just so excited to see you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh. Ew! Ew! Ew! Ugh! Y’know what? This is too weird.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: No-no it’s not! I don’t want to lose you! It’s-it’s like I was saying to Ursula when I was making love to her and I thought she was you—Yeah it is too weird.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So I guess this is it.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Yeah. Maybe it’s for the best. You smell just like her.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, so do you.

utterance.speaker: Brenda
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m leaning. This is where I lean.

utterance.speaker: Brenda
utterance.content: Okay. (Goes over and fluffs up the pillows on the couch.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Brenda a bee!

utterance.speaker: Brenda
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes! It’s flown into your blouse and you’d better undo your buttons lest it sting you!

utterance.speaker: Brenda
utterance.content: I think I know what’s going on here.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You do?

utterance.speaker: Brenda
utterance.content: Look, I know it must be hard that your wife is a lesbian, but it’s wrong. You’re married.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I totally understand. Can I just see your bra?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Where did you get those jeans?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You gave them to me!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No I didn’t!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right, I took them. But I figured it would be okay because you got a big ink stain on the crotch.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh no! Did you take my bra too?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What bra?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: The pink one with the flowers?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You mean the one that you’re wearing?

utterance.speaker: Brenda
utterance.content: I quit!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Sounds about right.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What is this?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! Uh, this is just to give you an idea. Okay well, we can put screens here, so that the baby has privacy, and-and-and maybe a mobile over the crib. And uh—Oh look! Here’s a baby monitor , which until the baby comes we can use as walkie-talkies. Huh?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You’re so sweet. Oh my God! And you gave the baby Hugsy!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ahhhhhhhhhhhh…. That-that-that’s really just to show where the baby would go. Y’know why don’t I hold on to him so that there’s no confusion?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: But Joey the baby is going to be crying, it’s going to be loud.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m loud!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It’s gonna be up all night!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m up all night!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It’s gonna poop!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hello!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What about all the women you want to bring home?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look, if I’m bringing home a woman who can’t stand being around a baby, then maybe I don’t want to be with that woman! Or maybe we’ll just do it in the bathroom of the club!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, are you sure?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah! All right—Look, I know sometimes it’ll be hard, okay? But, it’ll also be really…really great. Please Rachel! I-I-I really want you to stay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I want me to stay too.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ohh!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thank you. Oh Joey and look at this crib! It’s so cute!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know! I found it on the street.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Are you serious—Really?! It’s in such good condition.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow! Whoa-whoa what’s under the covers?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It’s moving.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ew.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It’s still——It’s got a tail! Get it out of here! Get it out of here!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ooh! Ah! Okay!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, the old lady died. And how do I know? Her dying wish was for one last kiss. But I don’t care, because you got the apartment. Yes!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ewww. Yeah. Umm. I think I’m gonna stay here.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Isn’t that great?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ezels!!
